name: df-abv
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cabv, cmpt(s0, crg, crab(s1, co(co(nat0, cico, cpnf), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wb(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), nat0), wceq(cv(s2), cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), cfv(cmulr, cv(s0)), cv(s3))), co(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cmul, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))), wbr(cfv(cv(s1), co(cv(s2), cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), cv(s3))), cle, co(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), caddc, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))))
comment: Define the set of absolute values on a ring. An absolute value is a generalization of the usual absolute value function ~ df-abs to arbitrary rings. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.)
